page.title: 14LEISURE
page.content: Three of the more popular pastimes in the area are golfing, curling and horse-riding. Caldwell Golf Club with 400 adult members is a 5547m 18 hole course with gentle slopes crossed by burns and bordered by mature woods.Par is 71 for men and 72 for ladies.There is a club house, kitchen and a golf shop. Uplawmoor Curling Club, instituted in 1869, has 61 members and competes against other Renfrewshire clubs. Regular winter curling takes place at Greenacres Curling Rink and outdoors at Peesweep if weather conditions permit. Horse-riding is popular with the younger set.There is a riding centre at Bowfield but fields and quiet country roads give ample opportunity for safe and enjoyable riding.
